block.p: Wendy Suzanne Abels, the daughter of Edith and Elvin Abels of Los Angeles, was married last evening on Vail Mountain in Colorado to Douglas Foster Eisenberg, a son of Betsy Sevin Eisenberg and Philip M. Eisenberg of Manhattan. Cantor Uri Neil officiated.

The bride, a graduate of the University of California at Santa Barbara, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Cornell, received J.D. degrees from Brooklyn Law School, where they met as editors on the law review.

Wendy Suzanne Abels, the daughter of Edith and Elvin Abels of Los Angeles, was married last evening on Vail Mountain in Colorado to Douglas Foster Eisenberg, a son of Betsy Sevin Eisenberg and Philip M. Eisenberg of Manhattan. Cantor Uri Neil officiated.

The bride, a graduate of the University of California at Santa Barbara, and the bridegroom, who graduated from Cornell, received J.D. degrees from Brooklyn Law School, where they met as editors on the law review.

Mrs. Abels Eisenberg, 31, is an associate at Rosin & Reiniger, a law firm in Manhattan. Her parents, who are retired, owned Abels Brothers & Associates, sales representatives in Los Angeles to the gift items and novelties business.

Mr. Eisenberg, 29, is the managing director for acquisitions and finance at Urban American Partners, a company in Union City, N.J., that buys, renovates and manages apartment buildings in urban working class neighborhoods. His father is the company's founder and chief executive. The bridegroom's mother is the finance director for the New York mayoral campaign of Mark Green.
